node.title: A Spontaneous Sedona Elopement
node.alt: Holly Lorka, left, and Melissa Shields.
node.description: Holly Lorka and Melissa Shields decided to scrap their plans for a wedding ceremony in Austin and get married amid Arizonaâ€™s red rocks instead.
node.content: ["It didn\u2019t take long for Melissa Shields to envision a future with Holly Lorka after they met in July 2019. When Ms. Shields got home that night, she had what she calls \u201cclicks,\u201d or pictures in her head of all the things the two might do together, like get married, have children and even be on a reality TV show.", "On Oct. 27, they checked the first item off that list.", "Mx. Lorka, who uses a gender neutral courtesy title, said she \u201cknew immediately\u201d that Ms. Shields \u201cwas into me.\u201d The feeling, Mx. Lorka added, was mutual. \u201cI got sweaty and nervous and dropped things. I also managed to charm my way into getting her info. I can be pretty charming, even while sweating.\u201d", "A native of Phoenix, Mx. Lorka, 52, graduated from Arizona State University and works as an intensive care unit nurse for gender affirmation surgery patients at the Hospital at Westlake Medical Center in Austin, Texas. She is also the author of \u201cHandsome,\u201d a memoir about gender identity.", "Ms. Shields, 34, is from Grafton, Ohio. A graduate of the University of Akron, she received a master\u2019s degree in education from John Carroll University in University Heights, Ohio, and is now training to be a yoga instructor.", "The two met in Austin, while Ms. Shields was visiting the city with her brother. Their first date took place on the concrete floor of Mx. Lorka\u2019s empty house, which had recently been vacated by renters. They spent it \u201csharing secrets and eating Thai food for seven hours,\u201d Mx. Lorka said. \u201cFor the next date, I made sure there were chairs. And other furniture.\u201d", "After the pandemic hit, Ms. Shields, who was living in Cleveland, relocated to Austin to spend the spring of 2020 with Mx. Lorka.", "\u201cI\u2019ve never had so much fun with someone who made me feel so safe,\u201d said Ms. Shields, who moved to Austin in the summer of 2021. \u201cAll we do is laugh and find joy in the simplest things.\u201d", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "On July 16, 2020, Mx. Lorka rented a boat for a surprise proposal on Lake Travis near Austin. The couple had originally planned for a wedding in Austin with just the two of them, but later decided to elope to Sedona, Ariz. \u201cI love how tranquil yet energizing the surroundings of Sedona are,\u201d Ms. Shields said.", "Mx. Lorka added, \u201cLike most things in my life, everything happened spontaneously.\u201d", "The day of their wedding began with a drive, led by Pink Jeep Tours, through the area\u2019s red-rock formations to the top of Schnebly Hill Road. \u201cThey bounce you all over the place and take you rock crawling,\u201d Mx. Lorka said. ", "Ms. Shields wore a burgundy dress she bought secondhand at the Austin Habitat for Humanity ReStore for $2. \u201cI have the same dress in black that I wore on one of our dates early on,\u201d she said. \u201cI thrifted that, too.\u201d Mx. Lorka wore a Calvin Klein suit.", "Jessica Thompson, ordained by Rose Ministries, officiated at the ceremony, which took place at Carousel Rock, a formation at the top of Schnebly Hill Road. \u201cWe had our ceremony next to the lone juniper tree that\u2019s up there,\u201d Mx. Lorka said.", "Of the ceremony, Ms. Shields added, \u201cI don\u2019t think there was any crying. We laughed the whole way up so we were totally relaxed.\u201d", "With a \u201cJust Married\u201d sign affixed to the pink Jeep they had booked, the couple made their way back to town for dinner at Shorebird, a restaurant in Sedona. On Nov. 6, the couple held an outdoor reception with 30 guests in attendance at Articulture, an events space and boutique in Austin.", "At dinner on the night of their wedding, complete strangers congratulated them all evening, Ms. Shields said, including \u201cfolks at the next table who had been going down Schnebly Hill Road while we were going up.\u201d"]
